intro: Agonandra conzattii, commonly known as the Conzatti's agonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, adapting to the unique ecological conditions of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
